title: Axios
text:
British Prime Minister Boris Johnson's minority government partner, Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party, said in a statement Thursday that it can't back the Brexit deal he's negotiating with the European Union "as things stand."

Why it matters: It's a major blow to Johnson ahead of a crucial summit with his 27 European Union counterparts in Brussels that's due to start Thursday afternoon. The DUP's support is vital to his plan to get an agreement approved by the British parliament. The United Kingdom is due to exit the EU on Oct. 31.
description: Smart, efficient news worthy of your time, attention, and trust
